Armored Meka Knitted Gator Aircraft Carrier
{ あめかにがく }

Designed for maximum stealth and strength, AMKGAC, or あめかにがく, is a prototype for a half stuffed animal, half armored stealth aircraft carrier. The design was inspired by years of Ultraman morning shows, Power Rangers, and Kamen Rider.

A collaboration between Yuta Tsubaki and Takashi Wickes, the work is projected to be funded and created by 2019.
An exhibition will be held during the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.
Work commissioned by Shinzo Abe for Tenno Akihito's 83rd birthday.

Components

+ Knitted Alligator
+ Assorted Lego Blocks

Personal Learning Areas

+ Product Design
+ Lego Design
+ Military Armory Design
+ Collaborating with world-class 8 year old designer
+ Photography

Lego Design Prototype

Top View

Components of the Lego build were created to maximize build strength and coolness. We ensured to protext the fragile body of the alligator, allowing for autonomous control of the piloting with safe and comfortable housing.

Front View

Front Right Propeller

Back Foot Hold

Tail Housing (for speed and control)

Riders
In order to defeat numerous kaiju and large scale enemies, AKMGAC is home to some of the newest technologies in military monster battling.

Mini King Ghidorah, enemy of Gojira (pour water for maximum size)

Mini Flying Car (Eco Design)

Design Team
Yuta, an up-and-coming design residing in the suburbs of Tokyo, Japan, offered his expertise in Lego infrstratucture and construction. Currently studying in elementary school for general studies, his acute design focus and experienced background made for an enjoyable collaboration and polished final product.
